OmeroScreen Plots
  • Normalise API
  • Edit on GitHub

Normalise API

The normalise module provides data normalization utilities for immunofluorescence data.

Main Functions

omero_screen_plots.normalise.normalize_by_mode(df: DataFrame, intensity_column: str, group_column: str | None = None, suffix: str = '_norm') → DataFrame[source]

Normalize intensity column by setting the mode (peak) to 1.0.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – Input dataframe

  • intensity_column (str) – Column name to normalize

  • group_column (Optional[str]) – Optional column to group by (e.g., ‘plate_id’, ‘cell_line’)

  • suffix (str) – Suffix for new normalized column

Return type:

DataFrame

Returns:

DataFrame with additional normalized column

Example

# Normalize p21 intensity by plate df_norm = normalize_by_mode(df, ‘intensity_mean_p21_nucleus’, ‘plate_id’)

# Normalize without grouping df_norm = normalize_by_mode(df, ‘intensity_mean_p21_nucleus’)

omero_screen_plots.normalise.normalize_and_plot(df: DataFrame, intensity_column: str, group_column: str | None = None, plot: bool = True, save: bool = False, path: Path | None = None) → DataFrame[source]

Complete workflow: normalize by mode and optionally plot results.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – Input dataframe

  • intensity_column (str) – Column to normalize

  • group_column (Optional[str]) – Optional grouping column

  • plot (bool) – Whether to generate plots

  • save (bool) – Whether to save the plot

  • path (Optional[Path]) – Path to save the plot

Return type:

DataFrame

Returns:

DataFrame with normalized column added

Example

# Complete workflow in one line df_norm = normalize_and_plot(df, ‘intensity_mean_p21_nucleus’, ‘plate_id’)

omero_screen_plots.normalise.plot_normalization_result(df: DataFrame, original_column: str, normalized_column: str, group_column: str | None = None, figsize: tuple[int, int] = (15, 5), save: bool = False, path: Path | None = None) → None[source]

Plot before and after normalization distributions.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – DataFrame with both original and normalized columns

  • original_column (str) – Name of original intensity column

  • normalized_column (str) – Name of normalized intensity column

  • group_column (Optional[str]) – Optional grouping column for separate plots

  • figsize (tuple[int, int]) – Figure size tuple

  • save (bool) – Whether to save the plot

  • path (Optional[Path]) – Path to save the plot

Return type:

None

Example

plot_normalization_result(df, ‘intensity_mean_p21_nucleus’,

‘intensity_mean_p21_nucleus_norm’, ‘plate_id’)

omero_screen_plots.normalise.set_threshold_categories(df: DataFrame, norm_feat: str, threshold: float = 1.5) → DataFrame[source]

Set threshold categories for a normalized feature.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – Input dataframe

  • norm_feat (str) – Name of normalized feature

  • threshold (float) – Threshold value

Return type:

DataFrame

Returns:

DataFrame with threshold categories added

Helper Functions

omero_screen_plots.normalise.find_intensity_mode(data: pd.Series[float], n_bins: int = 5000) → float[source]

Find the mode (peak) of intensity data using histogram analysis.

Parameters:

  • data – Intensity measurements

  • n_bins – Number of histogram bins

Returns:

Mode value (intensity at peak)

Examples

Normalize by mode:

from omero_screen_plots.normalise import normalize_by_mode
import pandas as pd

df = pd.read_csv("sample_plate_data.csv")
normalized_df = normalize_by_mode(
    df=df,
    feature="intensity_mean_p21_nucleus",
    condition_col="condition",
    control_condition="DMSO"
)

Normalize and plot results:

from omero_screen_plots.normalise import normalize_and_plot

normalize_and_plot(
    data_path="sample_plate_data.csv",
    feature="intensity_mean_p21_nucleus",
    condition_col="condition",
    control_condition="DMSO",
    output_path="output/"
)

Set threshold categories:

from omero_screen_plots.normalise import set_threshold_categories

df_with_categories = set_threshold_categories(
    df=df,
    feature="intensity_mean_p21_nucleus",
    low_threshold=500,
    high_threshold=2000
)
